page.title: 03CHURCHES, KING'S NYMPTON
page.content: The Parish Church of St. James is an attractive stone building with a copper steeple surmounted by a wind vane in the form of a cockerel.The North wall dates from Saxon times,while the threshold stone is part of a preaching cross which would have been used before the church was built. There is a beautifully carved rood screen and a fine painted ceiling in the chancel.The church is served by the local rector. The Methodist Chapel, originally mid-nineteenth century and renovated in 1904 is also built of local stone, some of the stone coming from Smytha Farm. This church is served by a Circuit Minister who resides in Chulmleigh.Both churches provide Sunday Schools for the young people. United Church Services are held at Christmas and on Remembrance Day.
